event: Here is the table of events and timestamps:
diagnosed with a palpable mass on her right breast
treated with chemotherapy (6 courses of ABVD)
invasive ductal carcinoma, G3, with triple-negative phenotype and MIB1 85%
staging CT scan of the thorax and abdomen
neoadjuvant chemotherapy with paclitaxel 80 mg/m2 plus carboplatin AUC2 d1-8-15 q28 for 4 cycles
temperature of 38.8°C and normal vital signs
elevated white blood cell count (21,000/mm3), with neutrophilia (16,470/mm3) and elevated C-reactive protein (250 mg/L)
broad-spectrum i.v. antibiotic therapy with piperacillin/tazobactam and daptomycin
defervescence and improvement in subcutaneous cellulitis and blood works
febrile seizure with WBC rise (20,510/mm3) and worsening of skin lesion
i.v. catheter tip showed positivity for Klebsiella pneumoniae sensitive to both meropenem and levofloxacin
mediastinitis and bilateral pleural effusion with left pulmonary atelectasis
left thoracoscopy with pleural and mediastinal drainage
admitted to the Intensive Care Unit for observation and support
broad-spectrum antibiotic and antifungal therapy, hemodynamic support and non-invasive ventilation
specimens of skin and subcutaneous and muscular tissue from necrosectomy
intensive inflammatory infiltrate including mainly neutrophils
systemic methylprednisolone 20 mg/day and topical cyclosporine
progressive resolution of mediastinitis and pleural effusion
blood works indicated progressive normalization of blood count and flogosis index
no change in the dimension of the lump
fibroelastosis and chronic inflammation, with isolated neoplastic cells for maximum 2 mm extension
restaging brain/chest/abdomen CT was negative for distant metastasis
BRCA and p53 mutation tests were negative
resumed chemotherapy with carboplatin and paclitaxel with dose reduction
completed her fourth and last cycle
